response.original_title: Σκοτεινοί θάνατοι στην αρχαιότητα: Ολυμπιάδα: Δίψα για εξουσία
response.overview: Olympias, a princess of royal blood, married King Philip II, gave birth to Alexander the Great, and ended up ruling the kingdom of Macedonia. Raised in a male-dominated society, she prevailed against her opponents and imposed her will. How is it that such a powerful woman faced such a horrible death in the end?
response.title: Mysterious Deaths in Ancient Greece: Olympias: Thirst for Power
